ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: Restoring a deleted character
ygData.msgSnippet: Characters are stored at least 3 months after they get deleted or even if the account gets deleted. ... From: apcooper [mailto:apc@talk21.com] Sent: den 27 maj
ygData.messageBody:
Characters are stored at least 3 months after they get deleted or even if
the account gets deleted.

-----Original Message-----
From: apcooper [mailto:apc@...]
Sent: den 27 maj 2003 13:55
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Restoring a deleted character


Thank you very much indeed for your quick response :-)

My son has used /petition to contact a gm and explained what happened.

Regarding patches - how often do these occur? The concern is that the
EQ autoloader downloads everything on startup. I assume that the data
with respect to each character are stored on the EQ server and no the
local PC?

Thanks once again!


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Tracy Fowler" <wareagletsf@a...>
wrote:
> yes a deleted charature can be restored contact a gm in game and
explain what happened and it may take a while, you have to do it
before the next patch, otherwise it cant be done
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: apcooper
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2003 7:44 AM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Restoring a deleted character
>
>
> Please help if you can!
>
> My son has just accidentally deleted his best character, which he
has
> been working with for many months. Obviously he is most upset.
>
> Can the character be restored, and if so, what is the procedure?
>
> Many thanks in anticipation!
